title: Quotes about Design
content:
I once read a quote that went something like this:

**Good design is the balance between monotony and overindulgence.**

I don’t know who said it, but I love the simplicity of it. It really gets to the heart of where design starts and ends.

Following in the foot steps from this thread ( [http://typophile.com/node/13406](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201165205/http:/typophile.com/node/13406 "http://typophile.com/node/13406")) are there any design specific quotes that are inspiring, you’d like to share?

 [‹ "Upper & Lower case" magazine published in paper](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201165205/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48638 "Go to previous forum topic") [Seriously, what's with these logos? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201165205/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48952 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Asvetic

comments.content:
“As long as the message is pure, the more gently it is spoken, the more forcefully it will reverberate into the world’s receptive places, as a penetrating whisper.” – Kenya Hara

“I don’t want to be original, I want to be good” — Mies

“Pushpin Studios brilliantly married conceptual imagery (both illustration and photography) with eclectic, often decorative typography. They did so to make a specific point or to tell a joke. It seemed to me to be the most generous form of design. It told you what you needed to know and entertained you at the same time.” — **Paula Scher**

“If I can’t think it, I can’t do it.” — **George Orwell**

“To maintain any creative longevity a designer today must reinvent his or her work every five years. This does not mean simply changing style. It means reassessing one’s approach — again, design is an art of planning — and finding a way that is new yet still reflects on one’s core ethic and aesthetic. This entails a reevaluation of one’s visual vocabulary, new technologies, the cultural zeitgeist, and the scale on which one works. Reinvention is personal growth.” — **Paula Scher**

Not about design per se, but creativity:

“Creativity can solve almost any problem.  
The Creative Act, the defeat of habit by originality, overcomes everything.”

George Lois
